body_content.explanation: a dish, originally from Vienna in Austria, of a thin slice of meat, usually veal (= meat from a young cow) that is covered in egg and very small pieces of bread before being fried:
examples: My Wiener schnitzel was served garnished with lemon and came with a potato salad.
Because we were in Vienna, we felt that we had to eat authentic Wiener schnitzel, washed down with beer.
When preparing Wiener schnitzels, make sure that you give the slices of veal a good beating before coating them in breadcrumbs.
